item.title: TonRunner
item.description:
TonRunner

This is my scrapbook of all things that interest, amuse, fascinate and inspire me in the world of swimming, cycling and running. I could have done it on facebook but all my friends and family are probably sick to death of my constant witterings and ramblings.Â

item.title: My 100th parkrun
item.description:
My 100th parkrun

Today was my 100th parkrun; my 80th run at Tonbridge. I have have been a first finisher I have been a final finisher, I have run several PB's although seen my average time increase by 4 minutes.

item.title: DreamRide
item.description:
DreamRide

Enter a dream world where the trails never end. Where the promise of joy and freedom exist around each bend. Take a magical trip through beautiful landscapes and join us on this DreamRide. DreamRide was filmed in Utah, Nevada, California, Oregon, and Washington in the Fall of 2015.

item.title: parkrun #118
item.description:
parkrun #118

The apricot T-shirt gets a run out in the sun for the first time.

item.title: Standard Distance:1900m swim, 40km Ride, 10km Bike
item.description:
Standard Distance:1900m swim, 40km Ride, 10km Bike

A beautiful but challenging course for my first standard distance triathlon. Posted a 2hr32min time which put me in 64th position out of about 800 so happy with that.

item.title: LOL! Barefoot running just the sort of mental thing we wanted, say fitness freaks
item.description:
LOL! Barefoot running just the sort of mental thing we wanted, say fitness freaks

TRENDY barefoot running is the perfect combination of misery, showing off and pain, according to exercise fanatics. Running without footwear supposedly improves performance, although the key benefits to fitness obsessives are proving how hard they are and making people stare at them.

item.title: Brighton Half Marathon 2016
item.description:
Brighton Half Marathon 2016

Sunday 28th February; this is the sixth consecutive year that I have run the Brighton Half, indeed this race was my first ever one over 10km. The weather that day was wet cold, blowing a gale and utterly miserable; it was so bad that at one stage I was going to quit it was only the fact that I was at the furthest part of the course and that I would have had to cover the ground anyway that I carried on. That was 6 years ago and thankfully we haven't had repeat of those weather conditions since. This Sunday was no exception, chilly yes but otherwise almost perfect running conditions. I say chilly as I parked the car the temperature gauge read 3 degrees; tights were a definite but I was still yet to make a decision on the long sleeve top.

item.title: Run away! Why it really doesn't matter what trainers you wear
item.description:
Run away! Why it really doesn't matter what trainers you wear

I'm not averse to running: I run most days, for fitness and fresh air, and because it's healthier than drugs for enhancing one's mood. It's sociable, too: I've made good friends through my local running club. But certain social aspects of this pastime bore me to the brink of despair, and top of the tree of tedium is trash-talk about shoes.

item.title: The Art - And Science - of Marathon Pacing
item.description:
The Art - And Science - of Marathon Pacing

Why we hit the wall in marathons, and how not to. My first marathon was the 1999 California International Marathon in Sacramento.
